question: Joshua has a flower stand at the town square. He sells three kinds of flowers: tulips, lilies and orchids. He usually sells tulips for €2.2328571428571427 per bouquet, lilies for €2.7715384615384617 per bouquet and orchids for €5.522 per bouquet. Joshua has no change today, so he has decided to round all his prices to the nearest dollar. If Joshua sells 9 bouquets of tulips, 17 bouquets of lilies and 38 bouquets of orchids, how much will he make?
answer:
Joshua will round his tulips up from €2.2328571428571427 to €2, since the number following the 2 is 5 or higher.
Joshua will round his lilies up from €2.7715384615384617 to €3, since the number following the 2 is 5 or higher.
Joshua will round his orchids up from €5.522 to €6, since the number following the 5 is 5 or higher.
Joshua sells 9 tulips*€2 = €<<9*2=18>>18
Joshua sells 17 lilies*€3 = €<<17*3=51>>51
Joshua sells 38 orchids*€6 = €<<38*6=228>>228
Altogether, Joshua will make €18 + €51 + €228 = €<<18+51+228=297>>297
#### 297
